intro: Misanteca sericea, commonly known as the silky misanteca, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, silvery foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
